1.text: I am the man that hath seen affliction by the rod of his wrath.

2.text: He hath led me and caused me to walk in darkness, and not in light.

3.text: Surely against me he turneth his hand again and again all the day.

4.text: My flesh and my skin hath he made old; he hath broken my bones.

5.text: He hath builded against me, and compassed me with gall and travail.

6.text: He hath made me to dwell in dark places, as those that have been long dead.

7.text: He hath walled me about, that I cannot go forth; he hath made my chain heavy.

8.text: Yea, when I cry, and call for help, he shutteth out my prayer.

9.text: He hath walled up my ways with hewn stone; he hath made my paths crooked.

10.text: He is unto me as a bear lying in wait, as a lion in secret places.

11.text: He hath turned aside my ways, and pulled me in pieces; he hath made me desolate.

12.text: He hath bent his bow, and set me as a mark for the arrow.

13.text: He hath caused the shafts of his quiver to enter into my reins.

14.text: I am become a derision to all my people, and their song all the day.

15.text: He hath filled me with bitterness, he hath sated me with wormwood.

16.text: He hath also broken my teeth with gravel stones; he hath covered me with ashes.

17.text: And thou hast removed my soul far off from peace; I forgat prosperity.

18.text: And I said, My strength is perished, and mine expectation from Jehovah.

19.text: Remember mine affliction and my misery, the wormwood and the gall.

20.text: My soul hath them still in remembrance, and is bowed down within me.

21.text: This I recall to my mind; therefore have I hope.

22.text: It is of Jehovahâ€™s lovingkindnesses that we are not consumed, because his compassions fail not.

23.text: They are new every morning; great is thy faithfulness.

24.text: Jehovah is my portion, saith my soul; therefore will I hope in him.

25.text: Jehovah is good unto them that wait for him, to the soul that seeketh him.

26.text: It is good that a man should hope and quietly wait for the salvation of Jehovah.

27.text: It is good for a man that he bear the yoke in his youth.

28.text: Let him sit alone and keep silence, because he hath laid it upon him.

29.text: Let him put his mouth in the dust, if so be there may be hope.

30.text: Let him give his cheek to him that smiteth him; let him be filled full with reproach.

31.text: For the Lord will not cast off for ever.

32.text: For though he cause grief, yet will he have compassion according to the multitude of his lovingkindnesses.

33.text: For he doth not afflict willingly, nor grieve the children of men.

34.text: To crush under foot all the prisoners of the earth,

35.text: To turn aside the right of a man before the face of the Most High,

36.text: To subvert a man in his cause, the Lord approveth not.

37.text: Who is he that saith, and it cometh to pass, when the Lord commandeth it not?

38.text: Out of the mouth of the Most High cometh there not evil and good?

39.text: Wherefore doth a living man complain, a man for the punishment of his sins?

40.text: Let us search and try our ways, and turn again to Jehovah.

41.text: Let us lift up our heart with our hands unto God in the heavens.

42.text: We have transgressed and have rebelled; thou hast not pardoned.

43.text: Thou hast covered with anger and pursued us; thou hast slain, thou hast not pitied.

44.text: Thou hast covered thyself with a cloud, so that no prayer can pass through.

45.text: Thou hast made us an offscouring and refuse in the midst of the peoples.

46.text: All our enemies have opened their mouth wide against us.

47.text: Fear and the pit are come upon us, devastation and destruction.

48.text: Mine eye runneth down with streams of water, for the destruction of the daughter of my people.

49.text: Mine eye poureth down, and ceaseth not, without any intermission,

50.text: Till Jehovah look down, and behold from heaven.

51.text: Mine eye affecteth my soul, because of all the daughters of my city.

52.text: They have chased me sore like a bird, they that are mine enemies without cause.

53.text: They have cut off my life in the dungeon, and have cast a stone upon me.

54.text: Waters flowed over my head; I said, I am cut off.

55.text: I called upon thy name, O Jehovah, out of the lowest dungeon.

56.text: Thou heardest my voice; hide not thine ear at my breathing, at my cry.

57.text: Thou drewest near in the day that I called upon thee; thou saidst, Fear not.

58.text: O Lord, thou hast pleaded the causes of my soul; thou hast redeemed my life.

59.text: O Jehovah, thou hast seen my wrong; judge thou my cause.

60.text: Thou hast seen all their vengeance and all their devices against me.

61.text: Thou hast heard their reproach, O Jehovah, and all their devices against me,

62.text: The lips of those that rose up against me, and their device against me all the day.

63.text: Behold thou their sitting down, and their rising up; I am their song.

64.text: Thou wilt render unto them a recompense, O Jehovah, according to the work of their hands.

65.text: Thou wilt give them hardness of heart, thy curse unto them.

66.text: Thou wilt pursue them in anger, and destroy them from under the heavens of Jehovah.
